Html:
Hi Guys,
I have been using Gmaps.NET for a very long time, its been working fine for months, then suddenly I am unable to run my Winform App anymore today, I have tried everything, even reverting code back 4 weeks where it was working.

My Gmap.net version: 1.7.0.0


Getting this error when firing InitializeComponent() for my form...


The type initializer for 'GMap.NET.WindowsForms.GMapControl' threw an exception

Inner Exception:
_
System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'GMap.NET.WindowsForms.GMapControl' threw an exception. ---> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Data.SQLite, Version=1.0.84.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=db937bc2d44ff139' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.

The SQLLite dlls are corectly extracted when opening VS2010.


Directory of C:\Users\JJ\AppData\Local\GMap.NET\DllCache

2014/07/13 09:17 PM <DIR> .
2014/07/13 09:17 PM <DIR> ..
2014/07/13 08:26 PM <DIR> SQLite_v84_NET2_x64
2014/07/13 07:51 PM <DIR> SQLite_v84_NET4_x86


I have tried to delete them, they come back when I open VS2010, so i think they are fine.

The demo's provided also work fine, which is why i cannot understand why suddenly this specific instance has broken today.


Is there a way to manually bypass this by referencing SQLLite directly in VS2010??

Any help or advice would be appreciated, as Im out of ideas :(

Regards,
JJ

I just got it to work again by directly referencing SQLLite X86 1.0.84.0 in my project references with Copy Local enabled.


But i read that this is not advised, and i never do this in past, so i cannot understand why now its broken.

Also tried to reboot PC about 4 times, no difference.


Thanks
JJ
